message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.SY, cs.LG, cs.MM

The paper deals with the design of energy-aware protocols for the Internet of Things (IoT) and proposes an optimal scheduling strategy to extend the network lifetime and guarantee a low overall distortion of the transmitted data. This involves the use of source coding techniques to compress the packets sent over the network, and the consideration of energy spent for processing and transmitting the data, as well as circuitry costs. Therefore, the paper is likely to belong to the following arXiv CS sub-categories:

- cs.IT (Information Theory): This sub-category deals with the study of information processing, transmission, and storage, which are all relevant to the design of energy-aware protocols for the IoT.
- cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture): This sub-category deals with the design, implementation, and evaluation of computer networks and communication protocols, which are all relevant to the proposed scheduling strategy for the IoT.
- cs.SY (Systems and Control): This sub-category deals with the analysis, design, and control of complex systems, which are all relevant to the optimization of the energy distortion tradeoff in the IoT.
- cs.LG (Machine Learning): This sub-category deals with the study of algorithms and models that enable computers to learn from data, which could be relevant to the proposed algorithms for the IoT.
- cs.MM (Multimedia): This sub-category deals with the processing, transmission, and storage of multimedia data, which could
